ex4D:plugin-description.p: This plugin allows access to Mac OS bookmarks.

Introduced in Mac OS X 10.6, bookmarks offer a convenient way of tracking down file system resources (files, folders, packages...) independent of their name and location. You can think of it as Mac OS aliases. Once a file system bookmark is stored in the database as BLOB, you can retrieve it's current location even if was moved, renamed or trashed in the meantime.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command creates a bookmark of the given file system item.

ex4D:argument.label: path
ex4D:argument.p: Path of the file system item to bookmark.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command returns the path of a bookmarked item.

ex4D:argument.label: bookmark
ex4D:argument.p: The bookmark previous created with BOOKMARK Create.

ex4D:return-value.label: path
ex4D:return-value.p: The file system path of the bookmarked item.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command exports the bookmark as an alias file.

ex4D:argument.label: bookmark
ex4D:argument.p: The bookmark previously created with BOOKMARK Create.

ex4D:argument.label: path
ex4D:argument.p: The destination path to export the bookmark.

ex4D:return-value.label: error
ex4D:return-value.p: 0 if the operation was successful, otherwise a system error code (NSError).
See Foundation Constants Reference for possible values.
